member.name: T:Furcadia.IO.Paths
member.summary:
This class contains all the paths related to the users furcadia installation.
***NOTICE: DO NOT REMOVE***
Credits go to Artex for helping me fix Path issues and contributing his code.
***NOTICE: DO NOT REMOVE.***
Log Header
Format: (date,Version) AuthorName, Changes.
(Mar 12,2014,0.2.12) Gerolkae, Adapted Paths to work with a Supplied path
(June 1, 2016) Gerolkae, Added possible missing Registry Paths for x86/x64 Windows and Mono Support. Wine Support also contains these corrections.

member.name: M:Furcadia.IO.Paths.#ctor(System.String)
member.param: Specified directory to look for a nonstandard Furcadia install

member.name: P:Furcadia.IO.Paths.CachePath
member.summary:
Cache path - contains all the Furcadia cache and resides in the global user space.
Default: %ALLUSERSPROFILE%\Dragon's Eye Productions\Furcadia

member.name: P:Furcadia.IO.Paths.CharacterPath
member.summary:
Character file path - contains furcadia.ini files with login information for each character.
Default: My Documents\Furcadia\Furcadia Characters\

member.name: P:Furcadia.IO.Paths.DefaultFurcadiaPath
member.summary:
Default Furcadia install folder - this path is used by default to install Furcadia to.
Default: c:\Program Files\Furcadia

member.name: P:Furcadia.IO.Paths.DefaultPatchPath
member.summary:
Path to the default patch (graphics, sounds, layout) folder used to display Furcadia itself, its tools and environment.
Default: c:\Program Files\Furcadia\patches\default

member.name: P:Furcadia.IO.Paths.DreamsPath
member.summary:
Dreams path - contains Furcadia dreams made by the player.
Default: My Documents\Furcadia\Dreams

member.name: P:Furcadia.IO.Paths.FurcadiaLocaldirPath
member.summary:
Furcadia Localdir path - this path (when explicitly set), indicates the whereabouts of the data files used in Furcadia. If localdir.ini is present in the Furcadia folder, Furcadia.exe will load those files from the specific path and not the regular ones.
Default: -NONE-

member.name: P:Furcadia.IO.Paths.FurcadiaPath
member.summary: Furcadia install path - this path corresponds to the path where Furcadia is installed on the current machine. If Furcadia is not found, this property will be null.

member.name: M:Furcadia.IO.Paths.GetDefaultPatchPath
member.summary: Find the path to the default patch folder on the current machine.
member.returns: Path to the default patch folder or null if not found.

member.name: M:Furcadia.IO.Paths.GetFurcadiaInstallPath
member.summary: Find the path to Furcadia data files currently installed on this system.
member.returns: Path to the Furcadia program folder or null if not found/not installed.

member.name: M:Furcadia.IO.Paths.GetFurcadiaLocaldirPath
member.summary: Find the current localdir path where data files would be stored on the current machine.
member.returns: Path to the data folder from localdir.ini or null if not found.

member.name: P:Furcadia.IO.Paths.GlobalMapsPath
member.summary:
Path to the global maps, distributed with Furcadia and loadable during game play in some main dreams.
Default: c:\Program Files\Furcadia\maps

member.name: P:Furcadia.IO.Paths.GlobalSkinsPath
member.summary:
Path to the global skins that change Furcadia's graphical layout. They are stored in the Furcadia program files folder.
Default: c:\Program Files\Furcadia\skins

member.name: P:Furcadia.IO.Paths.LocaldirPath
member.summary: LocalDir path - a specific path where all the player-specific and cache data is stored in its classic form. Used mainly to retain the classic path structure or to run Furcadia from a removable disk.

member.name: P:Furcadia.IO.Paths.LocalSkinsPath
member.summary:
Local skins path - contains Furcadia skins used locally by each user.
Default: My Documents\Furcadia\Skins

member.name: P:Furcadia.IO.Paths.LogsPath
member.summary:
Logs path - contains session logs for each character and a sub-folder with whisper logs, should Pounce be enabled.
Default: My Documents\Furcadia\Logs

member.name: P:Furcadia.IO.Paths.PermanentMapsCachePath
member.summary:
Permanent Maps cache path - contains downloaded main maps such as the festival maps or other DEP-specific customized dreams.
Default: %ALLUSERSPROFILE%\Dragon's Eye Productions\Furcadia\Permanent Maps

member.name: P:Furcadia.IO.Paths.PersonalDataPath
member.summary:
Personal data path - contains user-specific files such as logs, patches, screen shots and character files.
Default: My Documents\Furcadia\

member.name: P:Furcadia.IO.Paths.PortraitCachePath
member.summary:
Portrait cache path - contains downloaded portraits and desctags cache for faster loading and bandwidth optimization.
Default: %ALLUSERSPROFILE%\Dragon's Eye Productions\Furcadia\Portrait Cache

member.name: P:Furcadia.IO.Paths.ScreenshotsPath
member.summary:
Screen shots path - contains screen shot files taken by Furcadia with the CTRL+F1 hotkey. At the time of writing, in PNG format.
Default: My Documents\Furcadia\Screenshots

member.name: P:Furcadia.IO.Paths.SettingsPath
member.summary:
Personal settings path - contains all the Furcadia settings for each user that uses it.
Default (VISTA+): %USERPROFILE%\Local\AppData\Dragon's Eye Productions\Furcadia

member.name: P:Furcadia.IO.Paths.TemporaryDreamsPath
member.summary:
Temporary dreams path - contains downloaded player dreams for subsequent loading.
Default: %ALLUSERSPROFILE%\Dragon's Eye Productions\Furcadia\Temporary Dreams

member.name: P:Furcadia.IO.Paths.TemporaryFilesPath
member.summary:
Temporary files path - contains downloaded and uploaded files that are either used to upload packages or download them for extraction.
Default: %ALLUSERSPROFILE%\Dragon's Eye Productions\Furcadia\Temporary Files

member.name: P:Furcadia.IO.Paths.TemporaryPatchesPath
member.summary:
Temporary patch path - contains downloaded temporary patches. This technology is never in use, yet supported, so this folder is always empty.
Default: %ALLUSERSPROFILE%\Dragon's Eye Productions\Furcadia\Temporary Patches

member.name: P:Furcadia.IO.Paths.WhisperLogsPath
member.summary:
Whisper logs path - contains whisper logs for each character whispered, recorded by Pounce with the whisper windows.
Default: My Documents\Furcadia\Logs\Whispers

member.name: M:Furcadia.Logging.FileLogOutput.Log(Furcadia.Logging.LogMessage)
member.summary: Logs the specified log message to the file.

member.name: M:Furcadia.Logging.Logger.Disable``1
member.summary: Disables logging for the specified type.

member.name: P:Furcadia.Logging.Logger.MessagesExpire
member.summary: Gets or sets the messages expire time limit. Messages that have expired are removed from history. This property used in conjunction with SupressSpam = true prevents too much memory from being used over time

member.name: P:Furcadia.Logging.Logger.SingleThreaded
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [single threaded].

member.summary: Determines whether the specified , is equal to this instance.
member.param: The to compare with this instance.
member.returns: true if the specified is equal to this instance; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

member.name: T:Furcadia.Net.NetProxy
member.summary:
Furcadia base proxy connect between Client and Server. This is a low level class that handles the raw connections and furcadia proxy/firewall settings.
We don't have TLS/SSL handling here, so therefore, Furcadia Settings for this are disabled

member.name: T:Furcadia.Net.ServerInstructionType
member.summary:
Server to Client Instruction set. (Furcadia v31c)
This is the set that FF3PP understands and uses.
these can change with each Furcadia update.

member.name: F:Furcadia.Net.ServerInstructionType.SpawnAvatar
member.summary:
Spawns a new Furre in the dream furre list because they have joing the Dream we're in
'<' + user id + x + y + shape number + name + color code + flag + linefeed
sender object is Type SpawnAvatar()

member.name: F:Furcadia.Net.ServerInstructionType.RemoveAvatar
member.summary:
Remove the Avatar from the Dream Furre list because they have left the dream
')' + user id + linefeed
Source: Furcatia Technical Resources
sender object is Type RemoveAvatar()

member.name: F:Furcadia.Net.ServerInstructionType.AnimatedMoveAvatar
member.summary:
Move and animate the Active Furre to the next location
sender object is Type Furre()

member.name: F:Furcadia.Net.ServerInstructionType.MoveAvatar
member.summary:
Move the current active furre to the next locatiomn
sender object is Type Furre

member.name: F:Furcadia.Net.ServerInstructionType.DisplayText
member.summary:
Display formated Text.
Mostly Furcadia Markup but other stuff too

member.name: F:Furcadia.Net.ServerInstructionType.UpdateColorString
member.summary:
Update the Triggering Furre ColorCode
'B' + user id + shape + color code + linefeed

member.name: F:Furcadia.Net.ServerInstructionType.LoadDreamEvent
member.summary:
Download Dream Data
IE: ]q pmnaiagreen 3318793420 modern
respond with client command when furcadia client is not available "vasecodegamma"

member.name: F:Furcadia.Net.ServerInstructionType.UniqueUserId
member.summary:
Unique User ID
]z UID[*]
This instruction is sent as a response to the uid command. The purpose of this is unclear.
Credits Artex, FTR

member.name: F:Furcadia.Net.ServerInstructionType.SetOwnId
member.summary:
Set Own ID
]BUserID[*]
This instruction informs the client of which user-name is it logged into. Knowing your own UserID can help you find your own avatar within the dream.
Credits Artex, FTR

member.name: F:Furcadia.Net.ServerInstructionType.BookmarkDream
member.summary:
Dream Book Mark
Triggers Pounce to add the dream to the list marked temporary

member.name: F:Furcadia.Net.ServerInstructionType.LookResponse
member.summary:
received after a look at furre command
sender object is Type Furre

member.name: T:Furcadia.Net.Proxy.ProxySession
member.summary:
This Instance handles the current Furcadia Session.
Part1: Manage MonkeySpeak Engine Start,Stop,Restart. System Variables, MonkeySpeak Execution Triggers
Part2: Furcadia Proxy Controls, In/Out Ports, Host, Character Ini file. Connect, Disconnect, Reconnect
Part2a: Proxy Functions do link to Monkey Speak trigger execution
Part3: This Class Links loosely to the GUI
